channel.title: Fun use of the new dispenser

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @loverboyg6 loverboyg6
item.description:
@loverboyg6 wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:31, topic:378417”]Well if you’re not running out of wire length then you just need to set up a clock.

You can find schematics for a clock and a flip-flop.

However it’s digital electronics, a clock and flip flop works in binary. e.g 1, 0, 1, 0

Multiple flip-flops make it count more.
e.g. 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 0, 1, etc.

But they will always repeat.

Hope it helps.[/quote]

Thanks, but I had already figured this was the case when I posted my troubles in the official MC forums. Clocks do repeat, but for my purposes, even a 4 clock won’t be fast enough for a 2 dispenser trap I want to set up in my friend’s base in the Moparscape server. But it’ll have to do, or maybe a new trap idea is in order

Anyway, this is my current plan for one-wire dispenser traps (door is dispenser).

And this is the one that doesn’t work (rapid pulser does work with the dispenser, but not with gates).

Read full topic
item.source: Fun use of the new dispenser

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“loverboyg6, post:30, topic:378417”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=474284.msg3469972#msg3469972 date=1295213759]
Yes, I used repeaters to get to my dispensers.
Couldn’t get the rapid pulser to work though.
[/quote]

Well if you’re not running out of wire length then you just need to set up a clock.

You can find schematics for a clock and a flip-flop.

However it’s digital electronics, a clock and flip flop works in binary. e.g 1, 0, 1, 0

Multiple flip-flops make it count more.
e.g. 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 0, 1, etc.

But they will always repeat.

Hope it helps.
Yeah They burn out too fast to be used effectively for these things.

EDIT: I get the feeling you might be referring to something else though… can you take a screenshot of your set up? We might be able to help.

@LilXCj: I’m not talking about running out of wire length. Or maybe I misunderstood you. Can you explain what you mean?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.source: Fun use of the new dispenser

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“loverboyg6, post:27, topic:378417”]Actually, he used a clock, not a rapid pulser. If you look at the video more closely, you can see that the arrows don’t fire rapidly, rather in delays (it’s not noticeable because there’s so many). I figure that you can’t set up that many dispensers with a pulser, because they all only had one redwire powering them and to make a dispenser trap like that with a switch, you would need at least 2 connections to the dispenser.

I tried doing it with the pulser, but to now avail (maybe one of you guys could figure it out). Trying to make a dispenser trap with only one redstone wire connection is not that practical unless you have like twenty of them.

If you watch this video, you can understand more clearly what I am saying if you’re confused.

Hence wire extenders exist (inverters or repeaters)

Read full topic
item.source: Fun use of the new dispenser

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @loverboyg6 loverboyg6
item.description:
@loverboyg6 wrote:

Actually, he used a clock, not a rapid pulser. If you look at the video more closely, you can see that the arrows don’t fire rapidly, rather in delays (it’s not noticeable because there’s so many). I figure that you can’t set up that many dispensers with a pulser, because they all only had one redwire powering them and to make a dispenser trap like that with a switch, you would need at least 2 connections to the dispenser.

I tried doing it with the pulser, but to now avail (maybe one of you guys could figure it out). Trying to make a dispenser trap with only one redstone wire connection is not that practical unless you have like twenty of them.

If you watch this video, you can understand more clearly what I am saying if you’re confused.

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:24, topic:378417”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=474284.msg3469433#msg3469433 date=1295182475]

Trying to understand how he did it so I can replicate it…
Edit: Nvm that was just stupid. doing it now

It’s the same thing in the rapid repulser video except added into a machinegun wall covered in lava and extended using repeaters to extend past the 15 wire limit…

Except that it’s multiple dispensers. I am trying to figure out how to work a wall of dispensers; apparently, you cannot power them like so:

XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXYYXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX

Where Y are the powered dispensers, even though it says it’s possible in the wiki. Also tried powering the corner dispensers to no avail. any ideas?
[/quote]
The rapid repulser is just hooked up to all the dispensers (hence the staircase of wire and extenders) and is switched on just like the video with the lever by stepping on the place which is powered directly one block under it.[/quote]
I figured most of it out except that I couldn’t use the rapid repulser with dispenser walls bigger than 3 dispensers. It’s alright though, that’s what I wanted

Read full topic

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:

Edit: Nvm that was just stupid. doing it now

It’s the same thing in the rapid repulser video except added into a machinegun wall covered in lava and extended using repeaters to extend past the 15 wire limit…
[/quote]
Except that it’s multiple dispensers. I am trying to figure out how to work a wall of dispensers; apparently, you cannot power them like so:

XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXYYXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX
XXXXXXXXXX

Where Y are the powered dispensers, even though it says it’s possible in the wiki. Also tried powering the corner dispensers to no avail. any ideas?[/quote]
The rapid repulser is just hooked up to all the dispensers (hence the staircase of wire and extenders) and is switched on just like the video with the lever by stepping on the place which is powered directly one block under it.

item.source: Fun use of the new dispenser

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:13, topic:378417”]After looking at some of the related videos of that video I realized that my gun sucked so It was necessary for me to create a better one.

I basically made 2 rows of 3 dispensers stacked on top of each other (you have to abuse minecraft’s funny physics to do this) and added a little watch tower above to let you see the destruction!!

s2a3i.jpg863×506

The business end of it is simply one of those crazy clock generators that produce erratic but fast pulses of electricity which is perfect for this. The bottom row of dispensers get their electricity from the redstone on top of the 3 pieces of cobble in the picture below and the top row get theirs from the top of the dispensers. The whole process is started by a flick of a switch (which you can’t see in this pic).

RTDDe.jpg865×498
[/quote]
What I was hinting at but improved. Well done, FC

Read full topic
item.source: Fun use of the new dispenser

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

After looking at some of the related videos of that video I realized that my gun sucked so It was necessary for me to create a better one.

I basically made 2 rows of 3 dispensers stacked on top of each other (you have to abuse minecraft’s funny physics to do this) and added a little watch tower above to let you see the destruction!!

s2a3i.jpg863×506

The business end of it is simply one of those crazy clock generators that produce erratic but fast pulses of electricity which is perfect for this. The bottom row of dispensers get their electricity from the redstone on top of the 3 pieces of cobble in the picture below and the top row get theirs from the top of the dispensers. The whole process is started by a flick of a switch (which you can’t see in this pic).

RTDDe.jpg865×498

Read full topic

item.title: Fun use of the new dispenser
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:11, topic:378417”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=474284.msg3468579#msg3468579 date=1295123386]

I actually have a couple of these set up on my multiplayer map and they generate so much fun. I’ve killed numerous chickens, pigs, players etc. I store all the circuits in a nice little shed and have two of these babies sticking out one of my towers.

The major problem with these is that since the fire rate is quite fast, arrows disappear FAST. It’s only really viable if you spawn/cheat arrows.

You can pick your arrows up after you shoot them, right?
[/quote]Not from the dispenser.[/quote]
Oh that just sucks Donkey Balls.

Read full topic
